intro: Osyris lanceolata var. moroderorum, commonly known as the Moroder's osyris, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. It is often found in coastal regions and has a compact, shrub-like growth habit. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
